DataElement.preferredDefinition: The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid. Cells are highly variable and specialized in both structure and function, though all must at some stage replicate proteins and nucleic acids, utilize energy, and reproduce themselves.:Specimen; a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes._A subdivision of a particular kind of thing._The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid._Specimen; a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes._Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing._Text; the words of something written._Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Property.preferredDefinition: A subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not stated explicitly or in detail.

Concepts.definition: Not stated explicitly or in detail.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cells which are indefinitely maintained in a viable state at extremely low temperatures.

Concepts.definition: Cells which are indefinitely maintained in a viable state at extremely low temperatures.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A flat rectangular piece of glass on which specimens can be mounted for microscopic study.

Concepts.definition: A flat rectangular piece of glass on which specimens can be mounted for microscopic study.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cause to be firmly attached; stick or hold together and resist separation.: The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid. Cells are highly variable and specialized in both structure and function, though all must at some stage replicate proteins and nucleic acids, utilize energy, and reproduce themselves.: Blocks; refers to preserved specimens embedded in support material.

Concepts.definition: Cause to be firmly attached; stick or hold together and resist separation.
The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid.
Refers to preserved specimens embedded in support material.  These are typically cut into thin slices for microscopic examination, with or without an enhancement such as staining.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A method for rapid diagnosis that uses a frozen tissue sample rather than a chemically fixed sample._The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid._Refers to preserved specimens embedded in support material.  These are typically cut into thin slices for microscopic examination, with or without an enhancement such as staining.

Concepts.definition: A method for rapid diagnosis that uses a frozen tissue sample rather than a chemically fixed sample.
The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid.
Refers to preserved specimens embedded in support material.  These are typically cut into thin slices for microscopic examination, with or without an enhancement such as staining.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A method for rapid diagnosis that uses a frozen tissue sample rather than a chemically fixed sample._The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid._Formation by cetrifugation of a tightly packed sample in the bottom of a tube.

Concepts.definition: A method for rapid diagnosis that uses a frozen tissue sample rather than a chemically fixed sample.
The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid.
Formation by cetrifugation of a tightly packed sample in the bottom of a tube.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Body tissue, region, surface, cavity, fluid, organ, or collection of organs.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.:Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
